modules.description: Handles error, secret, and success responses for TOTP authentication flows. Accepts a request and relevant data to generate tailored HTTP responses. Used to guide users through error handling, secret generation, and confirmation of TOTP activation.

Generates JSON-based HTTP responses for TOTP-related actions, including error messages, secret delivery, and confirmation of TOTP activation. It handles request objects and string data to construct appropriate HTTP responses. Used to manage user authentication flows by communicating setup steps and status updates.

Generates HTML responses by embedding dynamic content into predefined templates. It uses strings and template literals to construct structured web outputs. Specifically, it inserts application names into HTML snippets for consistent branding across pages.

Generates and verifies encrypted passwords using the Argon2 algorithm. It operates on a type `t` that encapsulates password data and configuration. Used to securely store user credentials and validate login attempts against stored hashes.

Encrypted password generation and verification using Argon2, accepting a user model type `t` and returning a hashed string. The module includes functionality to check a plaintext password against the stored hash. It is used to securely handle password storage and authentication in user authentication workflows.

Generates HTTP responses for TOTP-related user interactions, including error messages, secret display during setup, and confirmation of TOTP activation. Works with request objects, error types, and strings to construct tailored HTTP replies. Used to guide users through TOTP configuration and handle validation feedback.

Handles user authentication through strategy-based verification, including session management and middleware integration. Operates on user session data and authentication strategies represented as functions. Used to secure routes by validating user credentials via configured authentication methods.

Handles secure password and TOTP authentication by generating and verifying Argon2 hashes and constructing HTTP responses for TOTP setup and validation. Accepts user model types and request objects to produce tailored outputs, including error messages and secret displays. Supports password strength checks and TOTP activation confirmations. Enables secure user authentication workflows with cryptographic safety and user guidance.
